001package imagingbook.testutils;
002
003import org.junit.Test;
004
005import imagingbook.core.resource.ImageResource;
006
007/**
008 * This class should be extended by some static class nested
009 * inside a {@link ImageResource} enum type.
010 * If so defined, the {@link ImageResource} will be tested automatically.
011 * See {@link BinaryTestImage}, for example.
012 * 
013 * @author WB
014 */
015public abstract class ImageResourceSelfTest {
016        
017        /**
018         * This method must be called from on an instance of a public class nested inside 
019         * an ImageResource enum type.
020         * JUnit will instantiate this class and execute this test method.
021         */
022        @Test
023        @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "rawtypes" })
024        public void testMe() {
025                Class clazz = this.getClass().getEnclosingClass();
026                if (clazz == null) {
027                        throw new RuntimeException(clazz + " has no enclosing class");
028                }
029                ResourceTestUtils.testImageResource(clazz);
030//              ResourceTestUtils.testImageResource((Class)nestedItem.getClass().getEnclosingClass());
031        }
032        
033//      /**
034//       * Scans all resources defined by enumClass, validates that they can be opened
035//       * as images.
036//       */
037//      private static <E extends Enum<E>> void testImageResource(Class<E> enumClass) {
038//              assertTrue("enum is not a ImageResource", ImageResource.class.isAssignableFrom(enumClass));
039//              if (ImageResource.class.isAssignableFrom(enumClass)) {
040//                      for (E c : enumClass.getEnumConstants()) {
041//                              ImageResource ir = (ImageResource) c;
042//                              File file = new File(ir.getRelativePath());
043//                              assertNotNull("could not find file " + file.getAbsolutePath(), ir.getURL());
044//                              assertNotNull("could not open image for resource " + ir,  ir.getImage());
045//                      }
046//              }
047//      }
048
049}
